creator: danson@germane-software.com
text:
This was found in the Ant 1.6 alpha nightly build from 4/4/2003.
Project.getTarget() returns one too many targets in the returned hashtable. One
target is always named "" (empty String) and is not a target found in the build
file. I believe the extra target is actually introduced by
org.apache.tools.ant.helper.ProjectHelper2 near line 565.

This is the implicit target - containing all top-level tasks and types. Is it a
problem to have this returned?
creator: conor@apache.org
danson@germane-software.com
text:
It's not a problem if that is the expected behaviour. Ant 1.5.x did not do this.
I have a GUI application (Antelope) that uses Project.getTargets() to create a
button panel containing a button for each target. I can adjust Antelope to
ignore targets named "", but wanted to be sure the extra target was actually
intended behaviour before doing so. How is this 'implicit' target to be used in
Ant 1.6?

creator: danson@germane-software.com
text:
This isn't a bug, it's a feature. The "extra" target is in fact the new default,
top-level anonymous target, which allows tasks to exist outside of a regular
target.
